title: Unknown
content:
Hello everyone,

I have this font I can't figure out which is. I have two images of it. I don't know if it's the same or not, but I would appreciate your help on this one ;) Thanks in advance :)

[![Dodaj.rs](http://web.archive.org/web/20150214073447im_/http:/www.dodaj.rs/t/1Q/Ut/W3PvZj/screenshot2015-02-05-17-.jpg)](http://web.archive.org/web/20150214073447/http:/www.dodaj.rs/?1Q/Ut/W3PvZj/screenshot2015-02-05-17-.png) [![Dodaj.rs](http://web.archive.org/web/20150214073447im_/http:/www.dodaj.rs/t/2M/cn/qLOTtxo/untitled-2.jpg)](http://web.archive.org/web/20150214073447/http:/www.dodaj.rs/?2M/cn/qLOTtxo/untitled-2.png)
author: Mikey87

comments.content:
|303| appears to be Ashely Script:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/ashley-script-mt/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150214073447/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/ashley-script-mt/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/ashley-script-mt/")

|MEGA| is not the same typeface, and I've had no luck identifying it.
Yes, you are right about Ashley script. Thanks for that. Hope to find the "Mega" one :D thanks once again for your effort :)

I'd be extremely surprised if the logo for classic Danish record company Mega records was anything other than lettering. This style of writing is technically not impossible to reporduce with 1983 font technology, but I'd still wager good money on it being made by hand.

One good indicator of this is that the original logo was slimmer and slightly different:

![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150214073447im_/http:/cdn.discogs.com/QRHCJ1mufHSoj50AmPMknkCw3NA=/fit-in/180x180/filters:strip_icc():format(jpeg):mode_rgb()/discogs-images/L-2061-001.gif.jpg)
